page.title: 07Halls Farm
page.content: The history of the farm started in the 1800's when the father of the present farmer began to build the farm up.It was a small farm which had two other farms beside it,which were called the Rectory farm and the Whites' farm.When the farms were being sold he bought them making it a much bigger farm.When he died,he gave the farm to his son who is now the present owner.Unluckily there is no-one to carry on the job of being the farmer of Halls farm when he dies,so it will have to be sold.The farm is mainly arable,consisting of 503 acres which has three permanent farm hands. The crops that are produced are winter barley and winter soil rape which is sent to the crushes and then sold as margarine etc.In summer they harvest the crops using two combines.(For rest of{Halls Farm}see page 8)
